parceler.title: Parceler
parceler.description: Building a Modern Delivery Service Platform
parceler.content: Built for a Software Architecture and Design course, Parceler is a prototype shipping platform featuring real-world delivery service components like shipping quotes, real-time tracking, and secure payments, all wrapped in a polished, user-friendly design. Users receive automated email notifications at signup, upon creating a shipment (with a QR code for drop-off), and whenever a status changes. A chatbot on the help page answers queries, while a user dashboard lets customers manage shipments and drivers easily view and update assigned deliveries.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.content: Created to highlight my personal journey, this portfolio website is a dynamic reflection of my skills and growth as a developer, all wrapped in a polished, user-friendly design. Initially designed in Figma and built with React and TypeScript, it later transitioned to NextJS for improved performance and a chance to explore new technologies. The site includes sections that showcase my projects, education, professional experience, and technical expertise, with regular updates as I build with and try new technologies.

wellness.title: Wellness
wellness.description: Designing an App for The Elderly
wellness.content: Created as a UI/UX case study for a university project, Wellness is an app prototype designed in Figma to support elders in their daily lives. It tackles medication reminders, exercise, and social connections, using accessibility best practices and an earthy color palette. Guided by user research, interviews, and personas, the design includes features like vitals monitoring, emergency contacts, and a built-in radio. Wireframes, user flows, and storyboards showcase how thoughtful UI/UX can help seniors stay independent.
